page.title: 09EMPLOYMENT
page.content: AS THERE US VERY LITTLE IN THE WAY OF WORK IN OUR ACTUAL AREA, WE TOOK A SURVEY OF THE JOBS DONE BY PARENTS WHO DID NOT WORK OUT OF THE AREA. IN FACT,OVER 77% OF FATHERS DID WORK OUT OF THE AREA, THOSE EMPLOYED IN OUR BLOCK WERE ALL INVOLVED WITH FARMING SOME OWN THEIR OWN FARMS AND OTHERS WERE FARM WORKERS. VERY FEW OF OUR MOTHERS HAD PAID EMPLOYMENT,ALTHOUGH A FEW WORKED OUT OF THE AREA. THOSE SIX WHO HAD EMPLOYMENT IN THE AREA WORKED EITHER AS DOMESTIC HELPS IN LARGE HOUSES OR AS CLERICAL ASSISTANTS ON FARMS. THE ONLY OTHER WORK WE COULD FIND IN OUR AREA WERE A FEW SHOP ASSISTANTS AND PETROL PUMP ATTENDANTS. THIS REFLECTS THE LACK OF FACTORIES AND BUSINESSES IN OUR AREA WHICH IS ALMOST ALL FARMING.
